comprehensive_overview: NetCDF (Network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data.
core_features:
1. Support for a variety of data types including integer, floating-point, and text
2. Dimension scales for efficient representation of multidimensional data
3. Metadata storage for describing the data
4. Advanced compression and chunking techniques for efficient storage
5. Parallel I/O capabilities
6. Portability across different platforms
7. Integration with other data visualization and analysis tools
